citations.narrative:
On the morning of June 27, 2023, an adult female gerenuk and a calf male gerenuk were found deceased in their primary
enclosure during morning checks. Necropsy reports reveal antemortem and postmortem wounds indicative of predator
attack. Security video footage taken the night after the predation event shows a wild fox inside the primary enclosure but
unable to access the remaining animals since they were secured in the building for the night. The facility reported the
event to an APHIS Official prior to inspection. The facility has a program to trap and remove damaging wildlife from inside
the perimeter fence, of which 1 fox, 9 raccoons and 2 rabbits were removed between April and June 2023. During
inspection, several areas of the perimeter fence at ground-level had evidence of digging by rabbit-sized animals (including
presence of fecal pellets) on the exterior and interior side. One air gap created by a gate in the fence was identified as
being a plausible location through which an animal the size of a fox could pass.
Failure to maintain a perimeter fence that keeps animals and unauthorized persons out can lead to severe injury or death
of animals housed therein. All outdoor housing facilities must be enclosed by a perimeter fence that is constructed to
protect the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going through it or under it and
having contact with animals in the facility.
Correct by 3 April 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
